meanings.def: the act of causing somebody severe pain in order to punish them or make them say or do something
examples: Many of the refugees have suffered torture.
under torture His confessions were made under torture.
I heard stories of gruesome tortures in prisons.

meanings.def: mental or physical pain; something that causes this
examples: The interview was sheer torture from start to finish.

meanings.def: to hurt somebody physically or mentally in order to punish them or make them tell you something
examples: torture somebody Many of the rebels were captured and tortured by secret police.
torture somebody into doing something He was tortured into giving them the information.

meanings.def: to make somebody feel extremely unhappy or anxious
examples: He spent his life tortured by the memories of his childhood.
